00030 /*
00031  * Get_myaddress.c
00032  *
00033  * Get client's IP address via ioctl.  This avoids using the yellowpages.
00034  * Copyright (C) 1984, Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00035  */
00036 
00037 #include "Rpc.h"
00038 #include "Auth.h"
00039 #include <sys/socket.h>
00040 #include <stdio.h>
00041 #include <stdlib.h>
00042 #include <unistd.h>
00043 #include <net/if.h>
00044 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00045 #include <netinet/in.h>
00046 #include <arpa/inet.h>
00047 
00048 #define MY_PMAPPORT                ((u_short)111)
00049 
00050 /* 
00051  * don't use gethostbyname, which would invoke yellow pages
00052  *
00053  * Avoid loopback interfaces.  We return information from a loopback
00054  * interface only if there are no other possible interfaces.
00055  */
00056 int
00057 Get_myaddress(addr)
00058         struct sockaddr_in *addr;
00059 {
00060         addr->sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_LOOPBACK);
00061         addr->sin_port = htons(MY_PMAPPORT);
00062         addr->sin_family = htonl( AF_INET ) ;
00063         return (0);
00064 }
